title.narrative: RE-value Syria: Building Up Relational Values in Syrian Communities 2020-2021

description.narrative:
The goal of the project is to contribute to a better future for the war generation in Syria, where relational values inspire active citizenship, leading to opportunities for human flourishing.
12 community leaders, representative of socio-religious makeup of the target area, participate in expert council sessions producing a framework for promotion of relational values in their community.
60 children participate in series of ½-day workshops using materials based on expert council input.
60 adults trained in values seminar, 40 thereof receive 3 individual counselling sessions for trauma relief.
240 adults and children participate in community events.

The grant is given to the organisation due to their application to the COVID-19 Emergency Pool (Nødpulje) in order for the organisation to continue their skills development activities in India. Due to COVID-19 restrictions, planned development activities are in risk of closure, which would negatively affect results.
The goal of the project is to contribute to a better future for the war generation in Syria, where relational values inspire active citizenship, leading to opportunities for human flourishing.
